result.execSummary:
The defendant Angie Lee Medrano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $940.00 to Teresa F.-G. and $8,059.69 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund claim #141888-16. Restitution to be paid first.
Pay all mandatory applicable surcharges, fees, assessments and costs after restitution is paid in full.

Defendant is eligible for the  Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse program after serving the first 18 months of this sentence.
**9/29/2014  credit amended to 122 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other time being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Participate in vocational training if available.  Obtain/maintain full time employment or ful time school and part time employment.
Obtain mental health assessment.  Successfully comlete follow up treatment. Take any prescribed medication only in the manner/dosage as prescribed by a treating physicain.

No drug dealing or association with drug community, drug users/dealers or drug houses.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Cognitive thinking program.
Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain AODA assessment. Successfully complete follow up treatment.  Participate with random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

records.addlTxt:
Filed, signed Order on Petition for Civil Judgment for Restitution and Court Ordered Financial Obligations.
The court finds, orders, and adjudges that:
Judgment is granted against the defendant in favor of the victim(s) listed in paragraph 3 above for the amount unpaid.  The clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee;
Judgment is granted against the defendant for unpaid court ordered financial obligations in the amount of $1075.97.  The clerk is directed to enter this judgment on the judgment and lien docket without fee.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: It is ordered that the Dept. of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date.  It is further ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect her release upon receipt of this order.  - signed by the Court and filed.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 28 Judge Sanders

records.addlTxt:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a total of 122 days of sentence credit.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
DOC request to review JOC for possible excessive sentence credit.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING commencing  JULY 29, 2014 received and filed. (59 Pages.)
Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Copy of transcript requested by: REQUIRED BY STATUTE.
Restitution request from Department of Justice/Crime Victim Compensation Program, filed.
filed.

Attorney Parker C Mathers in court, defendant Angie Lee Medrano not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea hearing.  State's request for adjournment to allow victim to be present granted.  Adjourned hearing date selected with the parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Parker C Mathers in court, defendant Angie Lee Medrano not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Parker Mathers and Attorney Eugene E Detert in court, defendant Angie Lee Medrano not in court, in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Attorney Mathers has been retained by the defendant.  Attorney Detert allowed to withdraw as counsel of record.  Defense provided time to review this matter.  Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Eugene E Detert in court, defendant Angie Lee Medrano not in court, in custody and not produced.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for scheduling conference and Bail-bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Angie Lee Medrano in court with attorney Eugene E Detert.  Defendant Angie Lee Medrano in custody.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 hour curfew).  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Teresa FG; Scott S; Catherine S or Moises GM

Defendant Angie Lee Medrano in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Angie Lee Medrano in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
